titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Poynette Academy was first conceived in 1884, when a group of trustees formed to raise funds to open a school under the direction of the Presbyterian Church. The school ran into financial difficulties and was dissolved, and its property and buildings sold off, in 1911.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Poynette Presbyterial Academy. Minutes of the Board of Trustees, 1884-1914, discuss election of officers, erecting a new building and setting up the school, Academy expenses and subscriptions, hiring staff, and financial dealings. These minutes also include information on the dissolution of the Academy and the sale of its property. Minutes of the Trustees Executive Committee, 1906-1912, largely focus on financial matters of the Academy. Other materials in the collection include: Articles of incorporation, by-laws, and Articles of Dissolution; file of correspondence from 1903-1911; reports on religious work conducted at the Academy, students, and finances; copies of mortgages and insurance statements; historical information on the Academy; copy of the 1903-1904 Academy catalogue; and extracts of meetings of the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
